About Me

I am a 5th year Biostatistics PhD candidate at Vanderbilt University. My research interests include longitudinal data, epidemiological study design, and integration of multiple data sources to improve the precision of randomised trials. Currently, I am working with Jonathan Schildcrout and Ran Tao on ways to design cost- and resource-efficient studies for longitudinal data. Recently, I have started working with Amir Asiaee on causal inference and integration of data from randomised clinical trials and observational studies.

Before joining Vanderbilt, I worked as statistician for the “Nutrition, Development and Lifelong Health in Transitioning Populations” programme at the MRC Lifecourse Epidemiology Unit.
